FuncDef:
The pe-vid ce-vid command sets the inner and outer VLAN IDs carried in Ethernet service activation test packets.
The undo pe-vid command deletes VLAN IDs.
By default, no VLAN IDs are set.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the outer VLAN ID carried in Ethernet service activation test packets.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

Specifies the inner VLAN ID or the start VLAN ID in a range of VLAN IDs carried in Ethernet service activation test packets.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

Specifies the end VLAN ID in a range of inner VLAN IDs carried in Ethernet service activation test packets.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To set the inner and outer VLAN IDs carried in Ethernet service activation test packets, run the pe-vid ce-vid command. The reflector can loop packets carrying the specified VLAN IDs.
For the same test flow, a range can be specified only in one of the traffic-type, vlan, pe-vid, udp destination-port, and udp source-port commands. In addition, the difference between the start and end values cannot be more than 127, and the end value must be greater than the start value.
